India won by 6 wickets with 52 balls remaining.
Ravindra Jadeja picked up three wickets in two overs, turning the game in India's favor.
KL Rahul scored an unbeaten 97, hitting a six to win the match.
The partnership between Virat Kohli and KL Rahul was 165 runs, four runs short of being the highest against Australia in men's ODI World Cups.
Virat Kohli scored 85 runs and had a crucial partnership with KL Rahul.
India's spinners, including R Ashwin, Kuldeep Yadav, and Ravindra Jadeja, were highly effective.
Australia's batters collapsed to spin, with Ravindra Jadeja being the best bowler on show.
Jasprit Bumrah took the first wicket and bowled economically.
KL Rahul was solid in the team's tournament opener.
Mitchell Starc took the wicket of Ishan Kishan on the first ball.
